summary: The Treatment and Homelessness Housing Integration Act of 2024 directs the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to establish a demonstration program providing grants to Continuum of Care programs. These grants enable the referral of qualified homeless participants to Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics for treatment of behavioral health, mental health, and substance use disorders. The bill also mandates a report to Congress detailing program performance and the number of participants receiving disability or supplemental security income benefits.  It authorizes $50 million in appropriations for fiscal years 2025-2029.
